item.title: Tobi add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "Christmas crept into Pine Cove like a creeping Christmas thing: dragging garland, ribbon, and sleigh bells, oozing eggnog, reeking of pine, and threatening festive doom like a cold sore under the mistletoe." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Tobi add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "Green was the silence, wet was the light, the month of June trembled like a butterfly." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Tobi add a quote by Michael Thomas Ford
item.description: "When <i>The Journal of Words</i> compiled its list of the one hundred best novels written in English, do you know that <i>Pride and Prejudice</i> was number twelve?" She stopped pacing and glared at Jane. "And do you know where <i>Jane Eyre</i> was?" she asked. She looked at the four of them in turn, but nobody answered her. "Number fifty-two!" she shrieked. "Fifty-two! Below that pornographic travesty <i>Lolita</i>!" She spat the title as if it were poison. "Below <i>Huckleberry Finn</i>! Below <i>Ulysses</i>. Have you ever tried to read <i>Ulysses</i>? Have you ever finished it? No, you haven't. No one has. They just carry it around and lie about having read it." -- Michael Thomas Ford

item.title: Tobi add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "It's a strange thing to discover and to believe that you are loved when you know that there is nothing in you for anybody but a parent or a God to love." -- Graham Greene

item.title: Tobi add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "But it is impossible to go through life without trust; that is to be imprisoned in the worst cell of all, oneself." -- Graham Greene

item.title: Tobi add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "Her face looked ugly in the attempt to avoid tears; it was an ugliness which bound him to her more than any beauty could have done. It isn't being happy together, he thought as though it were a fresh discovery, that makes one love--it's being unhappy together." -- Graham Greene
